image.altText: Two people, their back to the camera, stand on the edge of a creek bank surrounded by bush. They are looking at each other.

props.synopsis: Australia has a painful past. For the first time, the country has been grappling with recording the stories of that history in a truth-telling commission.

title.children: Elizabeth owns the land where Russell's people were killed. They say it's time to talk

image.altText: A close up shot of Angus Taylor standing in front of an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Angus Taylor confirms the Coalition plans to reduce overall government spending growth and temporary migrant numbers, but says figures will be finalised after Tuesday's budget.

title.children: 'No ambiguity' on Coalition spending, migration cuts — but no specifics yet

image.altText: chalmers side profile

props.synopsis: The federal government will extend its energy bill subsidies until the end of 2025 as it frames its re-election pitch to voters around the cost of living.

title.children: Labor promises to shave $150 off energy bills in fresh election pledge

image.altText: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's misstep on the referendum is far from fatal but it comes alongside other hints the Coalition's campaign has stumbled in recent weeks.

title.children: Coalition loses momentum as 'thought bubbles' float into the policy void

image.altText: An Australian battle tank fires flames

props.synopsis: Operations stall at a logistics hub in Poland that is expected to soon receive Australian Abrams tanks donated to Ukraine's war effort.

title.children: Uncertainty surrounds Australian Abrams tanks donated to Ukraine

image.altText: Writer Hanif Kureishi poses for a portrait in a stone and brick archway, wearing a black coat and checked scarf

props.synopsis: Hanif Kureishi does not pretend his new life is anything but often hellish and a profoundly unwelcome shock. But he has also been moved and sustained by new discoveries about connection, creativity and love.

title.children: Hanif Kureishi fell off a chair and broke his neck. From his rage came a 'spark of life'

image.altText: Liam Ryan celebrates a goal for the West Coast Eagles in an AFL game against the Brisbane Lions.

props.synopsis: Dayne Zorko remonstrates with Harris Andrews after West Coast shoots out of the gates against AFL premiers Brisbane at a muggy Gabba. Later, North Melbourne host the Demons, and Fremantle take on the Swans in Perth. Follow live.

title.children: Lions stars in animated exchange after Eagles' hot start at the Gabba

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Really heated discussions between Lions leaders

image.altText: Pole position qualifier Oscar Piastri looking down pit lane following a qualifying session

props.synopsis: Australian Oscar Piastri will begin a Formula 1 grand prix from pole position for the first time on Sunday in China, seeking the third win of his career.

title.children: Piastri starting Chinese grand prix on pole, one week after heartbreak at home

image.altText: A woman in a tiara sits in the back of a car with a man in full military uniform

props.synopsis: At the age of 24, a brash and fiery Princess Anne was called "her royal rudeness" by the British tabloids. But when a man brandishing two guns tried to kidnap her outside Buckingham Palace, Anne's sharp tongue helped save her life.

title.children: How a fiery Princess Anne talked her way out of being kidnapped in 1974

image.altText: A man in a navy blue suit, white shirt and blue tie with short grey hair smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Struggling to gain traction at home after taking the top job, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer's performance on the international stage has been received differently.

title.children: Keir Starmer was struggling in the polls. Then he met Donald Trump

image.altText: Dark clouds over Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Experts say infrastructure in south-east Queensland and northern New South Wales needs to be built to withstand cyclones.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred a 'dress rehearsal' as severe events move further south

image.altText: three french police cars rammed into a civilian

props.synopsis: The car chase ended with the driver losing control of his car and smashing into a traffic light and three pursuing police vehicles hitting his vehicle, prosecutors say.

title.children: Police praised for 'composure' after crashing car into suspect in Paris

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaking at a podium.

props.synopsis: The leader of the federal Liberal Party is making some big announcements, including plans to sack thousands of public servants. It is 1951.

title.children: Who came up with the idea to cut thousands of public service jobs?

image.altText: Sleeping woman

props.synopsis: The days are starting to get a little bit cooler, which means daylight saving time will soon be ending in the jurisdictions that observe it. But there are still two weeks until the clocks change.

title.children: There's still another fortnight of daylight saving time. Here's why

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump's face.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attacks on the judiciary pre-election, as he personally fought criminal prosecution, was one thing. But the way it's escalating from the White House is stress-testing the separation of powers.

title.children: President vs judge: Deportations test Donald Trump's respect for law

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Two firefighters in protective gear, one with a hose, stand in front of large flames and heavy smoke.

props.synopsis: South Korean authorities deploy hundreds of personnel and 35 helicopters to fight the fire, which started on Friday.

title.children: Four people dead, hundreds evacuate homes as wildfires hit South Korea

image.altText: A photo of a capsized boat with people on its head

props.synopsis: The boat was carrying 13 people, including 11 Australian tourists, when it capsized in rough seas off Bali.

title.children: Australian woman killed as snorkelling boat capsizes off Bali

image.altText: A silhouette of a riot police amid smoke

props.synopsis: Hundreds of supporters gather to protest the detention of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu over allegations of corruption and terror links.

title.children: Protests erupt in Türkiye as top presidential challenger detained

image.altText: A brown spirit being poured over ice in a glass tumbler.

props.synopsis: Rum distillers are taking over a 1940s milk factory in the Hunter Valley, as the industry looks to go large in the international market.

title.children: Rum makers take over historic milk factory as Aussie spirits go global

image.altText: Grey beard man wearing white t-shirt and cowboy hat, leaning against fence, dam behind

props.synopsis: A property owner who wants to open his share of "God's country" to tourists says he is excited to get started after a lengthy and expensive legal fight to build an eco-resort.

title.children: Tiny homes boss ordered to plant 20,000 seedlings in eco-resort trade-off

image.altText: Tom Gleeson stands at a podium with the Hard Quiz sign to his left.

props.synopsis: You just couldn't stay away, could you? Let's see how poorly you do this week. It’s time to play, HARD!

title.children: Think you're smart? Show us what you've got

image.altText: A black and brindle border collie with nine puppies.

props.synopsis: Liz, who holds the record as the nation's most expensive border collie working dog, is adjusting well to her new role as doting muster mum.

title.children: These pups could become Australia's priciest working dogs

image.altText: A woman on a balcony with a sunset behind her smiling

props.synopsis: Psychologists say a ritual or celebration can help a person move forward from a difficult phase of their life.

title.children: 'Shedding the past': How celebrating her divorce helped Leigh move on

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob smiles in her kitchen while showing off a jar of pickled carrot peels

props.synopsis: Rebecca Buckley is getting creative to keep food on the table amid skyrocketing expenses. As more people face food insecurity in the cost-of-living crisis, researchers warn it can lead to disordered eating.

title.children: Rebecca went from survival mode to self-care when facing food insecurity

image.altText: Cherneka Johnson poses with her world title belt after defeating Nina Hughes in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Cherneka Johnson retains her WBA bantamweight belt with a dominant win, while George Kambosos survives a fierce test against Jake Wyllie in their super-lightweight showdown.

title.children: Aussie Johnson retains bantamweight belt, Kambosos earns title shot

image.altText: Woman faces camera with lawn mower and tree behind her

props.synopsis: When Barbara Brennan was in prison her home was looted and she was evicted. Now she's helping other former inmates with the difficult transition back into the community.

title.children: Shoplifting landed Barbara in jail, lawnmowing is keeping her out

image.altText: A woman wearing a mustard coloured shirt.

props.synopsis: We asked voters across the country to tell us what issues concern them most at the upcoming federal poll.

title.children: Voters spell out what they want — and it boils down to 'a fair go'

image.altText: A woman with her arms resting over a balcony railing.

props.synopsis: A short walk from the heart of Lismore are a bunch of homes among the gum trees on a dead end road called Pine Street. They call it a community, but the law calls it illegal.

title.children: Lismore squatters remain defiant in the face of the government's demolition threats

image.altText: Machinery inside a steel factory with little lighting

props.synopsis: New details about the state of the Whyalla steelworks were revealed in a legal document this week. Here's what we learned.

title.children: Why a Whyalla steelworks snapshot reveals 'more than we anticipated'

image.altText: She sits on a white sand beach in a big hat with the ocean behind her

props.synopsis: Gillian White swam every day, even when she was sick with terminal cancer. When she could no longer swim, she decided the time was right to say farewell.

title.children: Gillian died on her own terms, but advocates say others face barriers

image.altText: Emergency services parked next to a dam on a rural property.

props.synopsis: Ambulance Victoria has confirmed that a young child has drowned in a dam near Nagambie in Victoria's north.

title.children: Toddler drowns on rural property in Victoria's north

image.altText: A massive ball of flames and smoke rises from an electrical substation at night

props.synopsis: The British government has ordered an investigation into the country's "energy resilience" after a fire shut Heathrow Airport for almost a day.

title.children: UK orders probe into 'energy resilience' after fire near Heathrow Airport

image.altText: A camera crew working on the edge of a lake in Tasmanian landscape, with a mountain behind reflected in the water

props.synopsis: Australian writer and producer Vicki Madden is bringing the Scandinavian noir style to Australian screens. What makes Tasmania so well-suited to the genre?

title.children: Inspired by Scandinavian TV, Tassie noir is cold, dark and riveting
